definition[0]: weak and unsteady because of old age, illness, or shock
example[1]: Grandad was a little shaky on his feet (=not able to walk very well).
definition[1]: not sure about the exact details of something, or not likely to be completely right
example[2]: My knowledge of history is a little shaky.
definition[3]: not definite or firm, and likely to fail
example[5]: The market began a shaky recovery.
example[6]: After a shaky start at the beginning of the decade, the economy began to grow fast.
